questions.question: What is the concept introduced into MOF chemistry for the first time?
questions.answer: Retrosynthesis

questions.question: What type of MOF materials were synthesized using the concept of retrosynthesis?
questions.answer: PCN-224-based multi-component MOF materials

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using retrosynthesis in MOF chemistry?
questions.answer: It allows for the synthesis of complex structures at atomic precision.

questions.question: What activity did PCN-201(Fe)-Cu exhibit?
questions.answer: Cooperatively bimetallic catalysis activity towards the three-component Strecker reactions

questions.question: What was the main challenge in synthesizing multi-component MOFs with different inorganic SBUs?
questions.answer: The lack of control over framework assembly in one-pot reactions

questions.question: What criteria were used to select PCN-224 as a prototype for incorporating secondary linkers and metal clusters?
questions.answer: Existence of binding sites, large cavities, and high stability

questions.question: True or False: The synthesis of PCN-201 and PCN-202 was achieved through a dissolution-recrystallization process.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What was the key to successfully incorporating different metal SBUs into one framework?
questions.answer: Sequential installation of linkers and metal clusters in a prototype MOF through a series of known chemical reactions

questions.question: True or False: The cooperative bimetallic catalytic system in PCN-201(Fe)-Cu was due to the simple mixture of Cu and Fe MOF catalysts.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What was the main advantage of the cooperative bimetallic catalytic system built in PCN-201(Fe)-Cu?
questions.answer: It led to improved catalytic activity toward three-component, one-pot Strecker reactions.

questions.question: True or False: The retrosynthesis approach in MOF chemistry is limited by the availability of a large and diverse organic reaction library.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What was the main challenge in using TPA as a linker for constructing PCN-202?
questions.answer: TPA tends to exhibit a C3 symmetry, which is not compatible with the PCN-224 structure.

questions.question: True or False: The PCN-201(Fe)-Cu catalyst showed high stability and maintained catalytic activity after three cycles.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What was the role of kinetic analysis in the synthesis of multi-component MOFs?
questions.answer: It guided the stepwise incorporation of organic linkers and formation of metal clusters, avoiding undesirable thermodynamic products.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesis of PCN-201 and PCN-202 involved the use of a one-pot reaction method.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What was the significance of using DCDPS as a linker instead of TPA for constructing PCN-202?
questions.answer: DCDPS is a semi-flexible linker that can adjust its conformation to fit the pore environment of PCN-224, unlike TPA.

questions.question: True or False: The incorporation of catalytically active metal clusters into a robust MOF was achieved through the retrosynthesis approach.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What was the main benefit of the stepwise synthesis approach in constructing multi-component MOFs?
questions.answer: It allowed for the integration of different metal SBUs into one framework by avoiding undesired thermodynamic sinks.

questions.question: True or False: The cooperative bimetallic catalytic system in PCN-201(Fe)-Cu was less effective than individual Cu or Fe MOF catalysts.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What was the main challenge in achieving the synthesis of complex MOFs with multiple components?
questions.answer: The competitive assembly of multiple components usually ends up with a thermodynamically favored MOF as the main product.
